other_tests.findings: Normal pulsatile LH secretion, elevated mean LH (6.6 IU/L) and mildly elevated mean FSH (9.9 IU/L) in the presence of markedly increased estrogens.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Consistent findings but LH and FSH were above early follicular phase normal ranges.

other_tests.findings: resulted in a decrease in mean ovarian volume from 123.7 cm³ to 10.5 cm³ and estradiol levels from 1910 pg/ml to 47 pg/ml.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Demonstrated improvement in ovarian volume and estradiol levels with treatment.

other_tests.findings: Continued reduction in bone mineral density; z-scores of -3.8 at age 15.5, -4.3 at age 23.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Bone mineral density decreased over time with worsening z-scores.

other_tests.findings: Predominance of parabasal cells consistent with a hypoestrogenic state.
LH and FSH were above normal ranges, with estradiol (E2) and estrone (E1) markedly elevated.
Mean ovarian volume consistently elevated, with estimates ranging from 38.2 - 123.7 cm³.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Ovarian volume remained elevated over the years, with persistent multicystic ovaries.
